{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Premium Banking Officer",
  "description": "Regent Microfinance Bank Limited is licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) to operate as a Microfinance Bank. Regent Microfinance Bank is focused on Small and Medium Scale Enterprises, Traders, Farmers, the underserved and those with a flair for true high returns on investments. We are strategically positioned to provide excellent services to our customers and exceed all service expectations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Premium Banking Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Job Type: Full Time

Role Description


	This is a full-time on-site role for a Premium Banking Officer at Regent Microfinance Bank, located in Abuja.
	The Premium Banking Officer will be responsible for managing and enhancing relationships with premium clientele, providing finance solutions, overseeing investment processes, and delivering excellent customer service.
	The role involves day-to-day interaction with clients, understanding their financial needs, and communicating effectively to offer suitable banking products and services.


Qualifications


	Relevant qualifications: Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Finance, Business Administration, or related field
	Finance: Knowledge of finance solutions and loan processes
	Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills
	Business Relationship Management: Experience in managing and enhancing client relationships
	Additional skills: Ability to work independently and in a team, problem-solving skills
	Experience in the banking or financial services industry is a plus.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover Letter and Resume to:&nbsp;recruitment@regentmfb.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Premium Banking Officer Job at Regent Microfinance Bank Limited




        
    

        
        Regent Microfinance Bank Limited is licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) to operate as a Microfinance Bank. Regent Microfinance Bank is focused on Small and Medium Scale Enterprises, Traders, Farmers, the underserved and those with a flair for true high returns on investments. We are strategically positioned to provide excellent services to our customers and exceed all service expectations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Premium Banking Officer

Job Location: Abuja
Job Type: Full Time

Role Description
     

            
    




	This is a full-time on-site role for a Premium Banking Officer at Regent Microfinance Bank, located in Abuja.
	The Premium Banking Officer will be responsible for managing and enhancing relationships with premium clientele, providing finance solutions, overseeing investment processes, and delivering excellent customer service.
	The role involves day-to-day interaction with clients, understanding their financial needs, and communicating effectively to offer suitable banking products and services.


Qualifications


	Relevant qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Business Administration, or related field
	Finance: Knowledge of finance solutions and loan processes
	Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills
	Business Relationship Management: Experience in managing and enhancing client relationships
	Additional skills: Ability to work independently and in a team, problem-solving skills
	Experience in the banking or financial services industry is a plus.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover Letter and Resume to: recruitment@regentmfb.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resource Officer",
  "description": "Erisco Foods Limited is an indigenous food product manufacturer, incorporated in Nigeria in 2004 and started operations in 2009, manufacturing Tomato Paste, Seasoning, Rice, Milk cubes and more. We are firmly committed to producing high-quality products that combine nourishment with value pricing, as they strive to become one of Nigeria&rsquo;s largest indigenous foodmanufacturers on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Human Resource Officer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will support the HR department in implementing policies, managing recruitment, employee relations, performance management, and ensuring compliance with company standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate employee records and HR documentation.
	Support employee onboarding, training, and development programs.
	Handle employee relations and promptly address staff concerns.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws and company policies.
	Assist with performance management processes.
	Provide HR reports to management as required.
	Manage full-cycle recruitment: sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding.
	Develop and update job descriptions and job ads across platforms.


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 - 3 years of relevant HR experience (FMCG/Manufacturing industry experience is an advantage).
	Strong knowledge of labor laws and HR best practices.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite.
	Ability to work under pressure and maintain confidentiality.


Method of Application

Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@eriscofoodsltd.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Human Resource Officer Job at Erisco Foods Limited




        
    

        
        Erisco Foods Limited is an indigenous food product manufacturer, incorporated in Nigeria in 2004 and started operations in 2009, manufacturing Tomato Paste, Seasoning, Rice, Milk cubes and more. We are firmly committed to producing high-quality products that combine nourishment with value pricing, as they strive to become one of Nigeria’s largest indigenous foodmanufacturers on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Human Resource Officer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will support the HR department in implementing policies, managing recruitment, employee relations, performance management, and ensuring compliance with company standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate employee records and HR documentation.
	Support employee onboarding, training, and development programs.
	Handle employee relations and promptly address staff concerns.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws and company policies.
	Assist with performance management processes.
	Provide HR reports to management as required.
	Manage full-cycle recruitment: sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding.
	Develop and update job descriptions and job ads across platforms.


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 - 3 years of relevant HR experience (FMCG/Manufacturing industry experience is an advantage).
	Strong knowledge of labor laws and HR best practices.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite.
	Ability to work under pressure and maintain confidentiality.


Method of Application

Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@eriscofoodsltd.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Internal Sales Executive",
  "description": "Limeswood International Company Limited situated in Nigeria, stands as a respected entity specializing in Mechanical, Electrical, and Instrumentation services. As dedicated partners, we cater to a wide array of industries, particularly focusing on oil and gas, power, energy,&nbsp; petrochemicals, and manufacturing.

Throughout our evolution, we&rsquo;ve diligently nurtured a team of highly skilled engineers, bolstered by the support of our Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) associates. These professionals, renowned for their innovation and expertise, stand ready around the clock to assist our clients, minimizing downtime and enhancing process efficiency. Our track record speaks volumes, positioning us as the premier procurement and service partner esteemed by numerous clients across diverse sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Sales Executive
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a results-driven and technically proficient Internal Sales Executive to support our sales operations within the engineering and oil &amp; gas sector.
	This role is ideal for a professional with strong experience in preparing technical and commercial tenders, using procurement platforms like Ariba, and managing internal sales processes for products such as pipes, fittings, valves, and instrumentation.


Key Responsibilities
Tender Preparation &amp; Submission:


	Source and respond to Request for Quotations (RFQs), Invitations to Tender (ITTs), and Requests for Proposals (RFPs) from private and government entities.
	Prepare and compile tender documents in accordance with customer requirements.
	Coordinate with cross-functional teams (procurement, finance, technical) to meet submission deadlines.
	Manage electronic bidding platforms such as Ariba, NIPEX, SAP, etc.


Technical Sales Support:


	Understand client technical requirements and recommend suitable products (e.g., pipes, fittings, valves, instrumentation).
	Provide pre-sales technical assistance and product education.
	Act as the primary internal liaison between sales, procurement, and engineering departments.


Quotation &amp; Proposal Management:


	Prepare accurate and competitive quotations, pricing sheets, and purchase offers.
	Track and follow up on quotations, ensuring timely response and closure of deals.
	Ensure all proposals are aligned with company pricing strategy and margin expectations.


Order Processing &amp; Client Support:


	Process sales orders accurately in ERP/CRM systems.
	Maintain communication with customers throughout the order cycle (inquiry, quotation, order, delivery, invoicing).
	Resolve client issues efficiently and maintain high levels of customer satisfaction.


Sales Reporting &amp; Documentation:


	Maintain updated records of all sales activities, correspondence, and documentation.
	Prepare weekly/monthly sales performance reports.
	Track tender outcomes and provide win/loss analysis.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or HND in Business Administration,or a related field.
	3-5 years of experience in internal sales, technical sales support, or tendering within an engineering, procurement, oil &amp; gas, or industrial environment.
	Proven experience preparing and submitting tenders and quotations for technical products.
	Strong understanding of sales processes in oil &amp; gas, engineering, or construction industries.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel &amp; Word).
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management abilities.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.


Desirable Skills:


	Knowledge of supply chain, procurement, or technical product specifications.
	Previous experience working with EPC companies, IOCs, or OEMs.


Salary
N450,000 - N500,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;Hr@limeswood.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-12",

Internal Sales Executive Job at Limeswood International Company Limited




        
    

        
        Limeswood International Company Limited situated in Nigeria, stands as a respected entity specializing in Mechanical, Electrical, and Instrumentation services. As dedicated partners, we cater to a wide array of industries, particularly focusing on oil and gas, power, energy,  petrochemicals, and manufacturing.
     

            
    



Throughout our evolution, we’ve diligently nurtured a team of highly skilled engineers, bolstered by the support of our Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) associates. These professionals, renowned for their innovation and expertise, stand ready around the clock to assist our clients, minimizing downtime and enhancing process efficiency. Our track record speaks volumes, positioning us as the premier procurement and service partner esteemed by numerous clients across diverse sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Sales Executive
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a results-driven and technically proficient Internal Sales Executive to support our sales operations within the engineering and oil & gas sector.
	This role is ideal for a professional with strong experience in preparing technical and commercial tenders, using procurement platforms like Ariba, and managing internal sales processes for products such as pipes, fittings, valves, and instrumentation.


Key Responsibilities
Tender Preparation & Submission:


	Source and respond to Request for Quotations (RFQs), Invitations to Tender (ITTs), and Requests for Proposals (RFPs) from private and government entities.
	Prepare and compile tender documents in accordance with customer requirements.
	Coordinate with cross-functional teams (procurement, finance, technical) to meet submission deadlines.
	Manage electronic bidding platforms such as Ariba, NIPEX, SAP, etc.


Technical Sales Support:


	Understand client technical requirements and recommend suitable products (e.g., pipes, fittings, valves, instrumentation).
	Provide pre-sales technical assistance and product education.
	Act as the primary internal liaison between sales, procurement, and engineering departments.


Quotation & Proposal Management:


	Prepare accurate and competitive quotations, pricing sheets, and purchase offers.
	Track and follow up on quotations, ensuring timely response and closure of deals.
	Ensure all proposals are aligned with company pricing strategy and margin expectations.


Order Processing & Client Support:


	Process sales orders accurately in ERP/CRM systems.
	Maintain communication with customers throughout the order cycle (inquiry, quotation, order, delivery, invoicing).
	Resolve client issues efficiently and maintain high levels of customer satisfaction.


Sales Reporting & Documentation:


	Maintain updated records of all sales activities, correspondence, and documentation.
	Prepare weekly/monthly sales performance reports.
	Track tender outcomes and provide win/loss analysis.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or HND in Business Administration,or a related field.
	3-5 years of experience in internal sales, technical sales support, or tendering within an engineering, procurement, oil & gas, or industrial environment.
	Proven experience preparing and submitting tenders and quotations for technical products.
	Strong understanding of sales processes in oil & gas, engineering, or construction industries.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel & Word).
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management abilities.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.


Desirable Skills:


	Knowledge of supply chain, procurement, or technical product specifications.
	Previous experience working with EPC companies, IOCs, or OEMs.


Salary
N450,000 - N500,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: Hr@limeswood.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Assistant Warehouse Officer",
  "description": "Runola is a parent company with four subsidiaries (AdelooSuites, Runoplast, Runoclean, and RunoFeed)committed to delivering high-quality products and services to our customers. With a strong focus on innovation, efficiency, and excellence, we have established ourselves as a trusted name in the industry.

Our company operates across multiple locations, ensuring seamless production and service delivery while upholding the highest standards of professionalism. We value teamwork, integrity, and continuous growth, providing our employees with opportunities to excel in their careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Warehouse Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Asaba, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	Runofeed is seeking a male Assistant Warehouse Officer to support daily warehouse operations.
	The ideal candidate will ensure efficient stock management, accurate record keeping, and smooth flow of goods in and out of the warehouse.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in receiving, storing, and issuing raw materials and finished goods.
	Keep accurate records of all stock movements and transactions.
	Ensure proper arrangement, labeling, and safety of items in the warehouse.
	Assist in carrying out periodic stock counts and reconciliations.
	Monitor stock levels and report shortages or damages promptly.
	Support in loading and offloading goods.
	Maintain cleanliness and orderliness in the warehouse.


Requirements


	OND / HND / BSc in Logistics, Supply Chain, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 1&ndash;2 years of experience in warehouse/storekeeping roles.
	Male applicants only.
	Strong attention to detail and good organizational skills.
	Knowledge of inventory management systems is an added advantage.
	Ability to work in a team and handle physical tasks when required.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@runola.ng&nbsp;using &ldquo;Application for Assistant Warehouse Officer &ndash; Runofeed&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

Assistant Warehouse Officer Job at Runola Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Runola is a parent company with four subsidiaries (AdelooSuites, Runoplast, Runoclean, and RunoFeed)committed to delivering high-quality products and services to our customers. With a strong focus on innovation, efficiency, and excellence, we have established ourselves as a trusted name in the industry.

Our company operates across multiple locations, ensuring seamless production and service delivery while upholding the highest standards of professionalism. We value teamwork, integrity, and continuous growth, providing our employees with opportunities to excel in their careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Warehouse Officer
     

            
    



Job Location: Asaba, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	Runofeed is seeking a male Assistant Warehouse Officer to support daily warehouse operations.
	The ideal candidate will ensure efficient stock management, accurate record keeping, and smooth flow of goods in and out of the warehouse.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in receiving, storing, and issuing raw materials and finished goods.
	Keep accurate records of all stock movements and transactions.
	Ensure proper arrangement, labeling, and safety of items in the warehouse.
	Assist in carrying out periodic stock counts and reconciliations.
	Monitor stock levels and report shortages or damages promptly.
	Support in loading and offloading goods.
	Maintain cleanliness and orderliness in the warehouse.


Requirements


	OND / HND / BSc in Logistics, Supply Chain, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 1–2 years of experience in warehouse/storekeeping roles.
	Male applicants only.
	Strong attention to detail and good organizational skills.
	Knowledge of inventory management systems is an added advantage.
	Ability to work in a team and handle physical tasks when required.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@runola.ng using “Application for Assistant Warehouse Officer – Runofeed” as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Experienced Female Accountant (ICAN)",
  "description": "Multi-Net Group Limited is a leading investment and service provider in Nigeria, offering diverse solutions across multiple sectors. Our expertise includes: Oil and Gas; Engineering Procurement, Construction, Installation, and Commissioning (EPCIC); General Contracting; Security and Surveillance; Real Estate; ICT/Training and Consultancy; Agribusiness; Renewable Energy; Waste Management; Technical Consulting. With a commitment to sustainable growth and innovation, we provide exceptional services to clients in both the public and private sectors, ensuring our relevance in an ever-changing global market.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Experienced Female Accountant (ICAN)

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	Are you a detail-oriented and proactive Female accountant looking to advance your career in a dynamic and reputable organization? We are currently seeking a highly skilled Female Accountant with ICAN qualification and a strong audit background to join our growing team.


Key Responsibiiites


	Prepare and analyze financial reports in compliance with accounting standards
	Oversee internal audits and support external audit processes
	Ensure accurate and timely posting of financial transactions
	Monitor and improve internal financial controls
	Liaise with auditors, tax authorities, and other financial institutions
	Support budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning activities.


Requirements
Education &amp; Certification:


	A Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	ICAN certification is mandatory.


Work Experience:


	Minimum of 3 years of relevant accounting experience, including at least 1&ndash;2 years in audit (internal or external).
	Experience working in a structured accounting environment, preferably in a medium to large organization.


Technical Skills:


	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, Nigerian tax laws, and International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).
	Proficiency in accounting software such as QuickBooks, Sage, Tally, or any ERP system.
	Solid Microsoft Excel skills (including PivotTables, VLOOKUP, and formulas).


Core Competencies:


	Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High attention to detail and accuracy in financial reporting.
	Strong organizational and time management abilities.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	High level of integrity, confidentiality, and professionalism.


Other Attributes:


	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Willingness to learn and grow within the organization.
	Strong work ethic with the ability to meet tight deadlines under pressure.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to:&nbsp;multinetgroup2025cv@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Application for Female Accountant Position&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-27",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Experienced Female Accountant (ICAN) Job at Multi-Net Group Limited




        
    

        
        Multi-Net Group Limited is a leading investment and service provider in Nigeria, offering diverse solutions across multiple sectors. Our expertise includes: Oil and Gas; Engineering Procurement, Construction, Installation, and Commissioning (EPCIC); General Contracting; Security and Surveillance; Real Estate; ICT/Training and Consultancy; Agribusiness; Renewable Energy; Waste Management; Technical Consulting. With a commitment to sustainable growth and innovation, we provide exceptional services to clients in both the public and private sectors, ensuring our relevance in an ever-changing global market.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Experienced Female Accountant (ICAN)
     

            
    



Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	Are you a detail-oriented and proactive Female accountant looking to advance your career in a dynamic and reputable organization? We are currently seeking a highly skilled Female Accountant with ICAN qualification and a strong audit background to join our growing team.


Key Responsibiiites


	Prepare and analyze financial reports in compliance with accounting standards
	Oversee internal audits and support external audit processes
	Ensure accurate and timely posting of financial transactions
	Monitor and improve internal financial controls
	Liaise with auditors, tax authorities, and other financial institutions
	Support budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning activities.


Requirements
Education & Certification:


	A Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	ICAN certification is mandatory.


Work Experience:


	Minimum of 3 years of relevant accounting experience, including at least 1–2 years in audit (internal or external).
	Experience working in a structured accounting environment, preferably in a medium to large organization.


Technical Skills:


	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, Nigerian tax laws, and International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).
	Proficiency in accounting software such as QuickBooks, Sage, Tally, or any ERP system.
	Solid Microsoft Excel skills (including PivotTables, VLOOKUP, and formulas).


Core Competencies:


	Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High attention to detail and accuracy in financial reporting.
	Strong organizational and time management abilities.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	High level of integrity, confidentiality, and professionalism.


Other Attributes:


	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Willingness to learn and grow within the organization.
	Strong work ethic with the ability to meet tight deadlines under pressure.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: multinetgroup2025cv@gmail.com using "Application for Female Accountant Position" as the subject of the mail.
